    Graphs on attitudes and belief

    To have the main result on attitudes and belief, we would like to have aggregate patterns before going into the individual level data.

    attitude_dt <- prepare_data(mmtalent_df) %>%  
  mutate(AL=luck_fair,
         AT=talent_fair,
         AE=effort_fair,
         CL=luck_control,
         CT=talent_control,
         CE=effort_control) %>%
  dplyr::select(AL, AT, AE, CL, CT, CE, treatment, left) %>%
  gather(key = "outcome", value="value", AL, AT, AE, CL, CT, CE)
#> Warning: attributes are not identical across measure variables;
#> they will be dropped

    Now for creating the first graph: unconditional on political position:

    attitude_dt %>%
  mutate(outcometype = factor( ifelse(outcome %in% c("AL","AT", "AE"),"Attitude (unfairness)", "Belief on control")),
         f = fct_collapse(outcome,
                        Luck = c("AL","CL"),
                        Talent = c("AT","CT"),
                        Effort = c("AE", "CE")),
         fo = fct_relevel(f, c("Luck", "Talent", "Effort"))) %>%
  group_by(outcometype, fo, outcome) %>% summarize(m = mean(value), se = sd(value)/sqrt(n())) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=fo, y=m)) +
  geom_bar(stat="identity") + facet_grid(.~ outcometype) + 
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=m-se, ymax=m+se), width=0.2) + 
  xlab("Factor considered") + ylab("Mean outcome \u00B1 s.e.m.") +
  theme_bw()

    ggsave(here::here("graphs","attitudes_beliefs.pdf"))
#> Saving 7 x 4.5 in image

    Now, interacting with political position:

    attitude_dt %>%
  mutate(outcometype = factor( ifelse(outcome %in% c("AL","AT", "AE"),"Attitude (unfairness)", "Belief on control")),
         f = fct_collapse(outcome,
                        Luck = c("AL","CL"),
                        Talent = c("AT","CT"),
                        Effort = c("AE", "CE")),
         fo = fct_relevel(f, c("Luck", "Talent", "Effort"))) %>%
  group_by(outcometype, left, fo, outcome) %>% summarize(m = mean(value), se = sd(value)/sqrt(n()))  %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=fo, y=m)) +
  geom_bar(stat="identity") + facet_grid(left ~ outcometype) + 
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=m-se, ymax=m+se), width=0.2) + 
  xlab("Factor considered") + ylab("Mean outcome \u00B1 s.e.m.") +
  theme_bw()

    ggsave(here::here("graphs","attitudes_beliefs_pol.pdf"))
#> Saving 7 x 4.5 in image

    Regression table

    We want to put attitudes on the left hand side and try to explain it by the type of attitude and the perception of control in the situation.

    Now, we need to turn the data around a bit first:

    subjectives_dt <- prepare_data(mmtalent_df)  %>% 
  mutate(AL=luck_fair,
         AT=talent_fair,
         AE=effort_fair,
         CL=luck_control,
         CT=talent_control,
         CE=effort_control,
         id = row_number()) %>%
  dplyr::select(AL, AT, AE, CL, CT, CE, treatment, gender, age, left, income, edu, id) %>%
  gather(key="key", value="y", AL, AT, AE, CL, CT, CE) %>%
  mutate(key = factor(key),
         fct = fct_collapse(key,
                            luck = c("AL","CL"),
                            talent = c("AT", "CT"),
                            effort = c("AE", "CE")),
         outcome = fct_collapse(key,
                                attitude = c("AL", "AT", "AE"),
                                controlbelief = c("CL","CT","CE"))) %>% 
  dplyr::select(-key) %>%
  spread( key = outcome, value=y) %>%
  mutate(Luck = 1.*( fct=="luck"), 
         Effort = 1.*(fct=="effort"), 
         Talent = 1.*(fct=="talent"))
#> Warning: attributes are not identical across measure variables;
#> they will be dropped
subjectives_dt %>% sample_n(3) 
#> # A tibble: 3 x 13
#>   treatment  gender   age left   income     edu    id fct   attitude
#>   <fct>     <dbl+l> <dbl> <lgl> <dbl+l> <dbl+l> <int> <fct>    <dbl>
#> 1 Ex Post … 1 [Fem…    24 TRUE  3 [60 … 3 [Som…  1892 effo…        0
#> 2 Ex Ante … 1 [Fem…    31 FALSE 2 [ 30… 4 [Ass…   498 tale…        3
#> 3 Ex Ante … 1 [Fem…    34 TRUE  2 [ 30… 5 [Bac…   378 luck         9
#> # … with 4 more variables: controlbelief <dbl>, Luck <dbl>, Effort <dbl>,
#> #   Talent <dbl>

    Now, it should be possible to run the regression \[ A_{i,t} = \beta_0 + \beta_1 B_{i,t} + \beta_2 X_i + \phi_t + \epsilon_{i,t}, \] where \(i\) index the individual, and \(t\in\{ \mathrm{effort}, \mathrm{talent}, \mathrm{luck}\}\), \(A_{i,t}\in[0,10]\) is the fairness attitude, \(B_{i,t}\in[0,10]\) is the control belief, \(X_i\) is a set of individual controls, and \(\phi_t\) is a set of fixed effect for each factor.

    AB1 <- lm( attitude ~ Talent + Effort, data=subjectives_dt)
AB2 <- lm( attitude ~ Talent + Effort + controlbelief, data=subjectives_dt)

AB3 <- lm( attitude ~ Talent + Effort +
             age + left + as.factor(income) + as.factor(edu) + as.factor(gender), data=subjectives_dt)
AB4 <- lm( attitude ~ Talent + Effort + controlbelief + 
             age + left + as.factor(income) + as.factor(edu) + as.factor(gender), data=subjectives_dt)
subjectives_left <- subjectives_dt %>% filter(left==1)
subjectives_right <- subjectives_dt %>% filter(left!=1)

AB5 <- lm( attitude ~ Talent + Effort + controlbelief + 
             age + as.factor(income) + as.factor(edu) + as.factor(gender), data = subjectives_left)
AB6 <- lm( attitude ~ Talent + Effort + controlbelief + 
             age + as.factor(income) + as.factor(edu) + as.factor(gender), data = subjectives_right)

stargazer( AB1, AB2, AB3, AB4, AB5, AB6,
           se = list(sqrt(diag(cluster.vcov(AB1, cluster=subjectives_dt$id))),
                     sqrt(diag(cluster.vcov(AB2, cluster=subjectives_dt$id))),
                     sqrt(diag(cluster.vcov(AB3, cluster=subjectives_dt$id))),
                     sqrt(diag(cluster.vcov(AB4, cluster=subjectives_dt$id))),
                     sqrt(diag(cluster.vcov(AB5, cluster=subjectives_left$id))),
                     sqrt(diag(cluster.vcov(AB6, cluster=subjectives_right$id)))),
           style="aer", type="text", keep.stat=c("rsq", "n"),
           column.labels=c("All participants", "Left-wing", "Non-left"),
           column.separate=c(4,1,1))
#>

    Are there treatment effects on attitudes?

    The survey came after the experiment. Are there any treatment effect on the survey outcomes? We test for joint significance of the treatment effects for each of the 6 outcomes.

    A1 <- lm(luck_fair ~ treatment, data = df)
A1w <- glht(A1, linfct= c("`treatmentEx Ante Impersonal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Personal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Impersonal` = 0"))
A2 <- lm(talent_fair ~ treatment, data = df)
A2w <- glht(A2, linfct= c("`treatmentEx Ante Impersonal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Personal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Impersonal` = 0"))
A3 <- lm(effort_fair ~ treatment, data = df)
A3w <- glht(A3, linfct= c("`treatmentEx Ante Impersonal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Personal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Impersonal` = 0"))
B1 <- lm(luck_control ~ treatment, data = df)
B1w <- glht(B1, linfct= c("`treatmentEx Ante Impersonal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Personal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Impersonal` = 0"))
B2 <- lm(talent_control ~ treatment, data = df)
B2w <- glht(B2, linfct= c("`treatmentEx Ante Impersonal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Personal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Impersonal` = 0"))
B3 <- lm(effort_control ~ treatment, data = df)
B3w <- glht(B3, linfct= c("`treatmentEx Ante Impersonal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Personal` = 0",
                          "`treatmentEx Post Impersonal` = 0"))

wrow <- c("Joint p-value on treatment:", 
          sprintf("%4.3f", summary(A1w)$test$pvalue[1]),
          sprintf("%4.3f", summary(A2w)$test$pvalue[1]),
          sprintf("%4.3f", summary(A3w)$test$pvalue[1]),
          sprintf("%4.3f", summary(B1w)$test$pvalue[1]),
          sprintf("%4.3f", summary(B2w)$test$pvalue[1]),
          sprintf("%4.3f", summary(B3w)$test$pvalue[1]))

stargazer(A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B3,
          style="aer", type="text", add.lines=list(wrow),
          keep.stat=c("n","rsq"))
#> 
#> ========================================================================================================
#>                             luck_fair talent_fair effort_fair luck_control talent_control effort_control
#>                                (1)        (2)         (3)         (4)           (5)            (6)      
#> --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> treatmentEx Ante Impersonal  -0.132      0.076       0.121       -0.120        -0.259         0.110     
#>                              (0.193)    (0.192)     (0.189)     (0.190)       (0.188)        (0.195)    
#>                                                                                                         
#> treatmentEx Post Personal     0.061     0.366*      0.324*       -0.043       -0.341*         0.004     
#>                              (0.192)    (0.191)     (0.188)     (0.189)       (0.187)        (0.194)    
#>                                                                                                         
#> treatmentEx Post Impersonal  -0.005     -0.031      -0.056       -0.261        -0.084         0.130     
#>                              (0.193)    (0.192)     (0.189)     (0.190)       (0.188)        (0.195)    
#>                                                                                                         
#> Constant                    6.842***   3.144***    2.784***     3.543***      6.353***       7.194***   
#>                              (0.136)    (0.136)     (0.133)     (0.134)       (0.133)        (0.137)    
#>                                                                                                         
#> Joint p-value on treatment:   0.834      0.961       0.859       0.862         0.375          0.897     
#> Observations                  2,001      2,001       2,001       2,001         2,001          2,001     
#> R2                            0.001      0.003       0.002       0.001         0.002          0.000     
#> --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Notes:                      ***Significant at the 1 percent level.                                      
#>                             **Significant at the 5 percent level.                                       
#>                             *Significant at the 10 percent level.

    We see that 3 out of 18 treatment effects are significant at the 10% level, which is not surprising even under the null of no true effect.
